Award.AbstractNarration:
The PI is proposing to work on various aspects of the inner model program, which is the program for constructing inner models for large cardinals. He will concentrate on problems coming from descriptive inner model theory and will work on advancing the theory of hod mice. The long term goal of the project is to prove the Mouse Set Conjecture, which is a central conjecture in descriptive inner model theory. Immediate goals include advancing the core model induction technique beyond its current levels, and computing better consistency lower bounds for the failure of square at a measurable cardinal.

Mathematics is the language of science; it is what is used to express scientific predictions and theories. Mathematics is simply the most fundamental and indispensable part of science. However, just as scientific achievements must be tested for their validity, mathematical discoveries too must be tested for their consistency. Mathematical theories are based on axioms known as the axioms of Zermelo-Frankel set theory with the Axiom of Choice (ZFC). Provided that the proofs from ZFC and its various extensions are correct, it is believed that the resulting theories are correct. Set theory is the part of mathematics that deals with the consistency of ZFC and its extensions via Large Cardinal Axioms (LCA). Because of the celebrated Godel's incompleteness theorem one cannot hope to prove that ZFC or any of its extensions are consistent. Nevertheless, one can hope to provide naturally occurring models for ZFC + LCA in the same spirit that the set of natural numbers is the natural model of the axioms of Peano Arithmetic (PA). PA is the axiomatic system that guides and controls the usage of arithmetic in everyday life. The inner model program is a set theoretic program whose primary goal is to construct such canonical models for ZFC + LCA. The proposed project is a contribution to the inner model program. One specific objective of the proposed project is to advance the most successful recent method for constructing natural models for various extensions of ZFC, the core model induction, to new levels, and thus to construct natural models for extensions of ZFC that were unreachable before.

Institution.Name: Rutgers University New Brunswick
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: RUTGERS, THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW JERSEY

Performance_Institution.Name: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

ProgramReference.Text: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

POR.DRECONTENT:
The aim of the project is to understand the landscape of mathematical infinties and build models for these infinities. The axioms of Peano Arithmetic (PA), the usual axioms governing the use of natural numbers give a complete description of what natural numbers are. Most people have a clear sense of what the members of the set of natural numbers are, they are the numbers people use in their everyday lives.

Unlike PA, the ZFC axioms, the basic axioms of infinty, do not give a complete description of the objects that exist in the set theoretic universe. As a result, many questions about infinite sets are undecidable in ZFC and its extensions via large cardinal axioms. 

A central theme in set theory is to identify universes of sets that are concrete, analyzable and otherwise just nice yet they are not restrictive in a sense that they can have as larger objects in them as one wishes. The area of set theory that deals with this problem is known as Inner Model Theory and the above program is knowns as the Inner Model Program.  

The central aim of this project was to develop the theory of such models at the level of Woodin cardinals that are a limit of Woodin cardinals, which is a special infinty axiom that has played a major role in the development of set theory.

Nice models were build for Woodin cardinals that are limits of Woodin cardinals some 20 years ago by Itay Neeman under the assumption that such a large cardinal exists. The goal of the project was to build such a model in a unified manner and along the way connect many different set theoretic frameworks,- such as the Proper Forcing Axiom or the Axiom of Determinacy,- with one another. One of the main concrete conjectures whose positive solution would allow the development of techniques to unify various set theoretic frameworks is known as Hod Pair Capturing, and the PI showed that this conjecture is true in the universe where infinties larger than a Woodin cardinal that is a limit of Woodin cardinals do not exist. 

As a consequence, the PI has developed tools that will lead to a certain unified theory of infinte sets just below the infinity given by a Woodin cardinal that is a limit of Woodin cardinals. The most surprizing consequence of the PI's work was that one of the main approaches to building nice models to infinities cannot succeed according to the current norms and revision of the theory is needed.  

The study of infinities beyond a Woodin cardinal that is a limit of Woodin cardinals is ongoing, but the results of the current project suggest that the problem of building nice inner models for large infinities is not just a technicality and needs beautiful new ideas. The future of the subject is trully exciting as many new ideas are being developed by several researchers, and perhaps soon there will be many more exciting insights into the deep and mysterious world of infinties. 


Last Modified: 12/16/2020
Modified by: Grigor Sargsyan
